summary: This is an email chain from August 27, 2020, between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and an FBI/NYPD task force member regarding the drafting of subpoenas for four individuals in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The individuals are former employees or associates of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: David R Mullen
persons.context: A person for whom a subpoena is being drafted, identified by name, date of birth (DOB), and last known address (LKA). Mentioned as one of the four individuals who worked for Epstein.

persons.name: Lance Allen Calloway
persons.context: A person for whom a subpoena is being drafted, identified by name, date of birth (DOB), and last known address (LKA). Mentioned as one of the four individuals who worked for Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The case referenced in the email is the 'Maxwell case,' indicating she is the subject of the investigation for which subpoenas are being issued.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the employer of the individuals for whom subpoenas are being drafted. The subpoenas are for people who 'worked for Epstein.'

connections.description: David R Mullen is identified as an individual who worked for Jeffrey Epstein, as the subpoena is for people who 'worked for Epstein.'
Lance Allen Calloway is identified as an individual who worked for Jeffrey Epstein, as the subpoena is for people who 'worked for Epstein.'
The email discusses issuing subpoenas for the 'Maxwell case,' indicating the legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell are connected to the activities of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena Drafting for Maxwell Case
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys and an FBI/NYPD task force member coordinate via email to draft subpoenas for four individuals who worked for Jeffrey Epstein, as part of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: On August 27, 2020, federal prosecutors were actively drafting subpoenas for individuals connected to Jeffrey Epstein as part of the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
At least four individuals, including David R Mullen and Lance Allen Calloway, were identified as former employees or associates of Epstein to be subpoenaed.
The communication shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and an FBI/NYPD Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The document indicates the ongoing investigative efforts in the Maxwell case nearly a year after Epstein's death, focusing on gathering testimony from his staff.
